717745f-a.text:
Manhattan College, Broadway at the N.E. corner of 131st Street, showing also the north side of 131st Street from Broadway to Old Broadway. The college has abandoned this building and moved to the northernmost part of the Bronx; the present building will soon be torn down, and the lot will be vacant as late as 1936.
April, 1926.

721973f-a.text:
60-66 Old Broadway, at, adjoining, and south of the S.W. corner of West 131st Street. Nos. 64 and 66 are both frame houses.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 334.

717744f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from W. 131st Street, showing at the N.E. corner of that point, a cleared area and upon which formerly stood Manhattan College. Tbthe north of same is the Dash Co. garage and sales room occupying the balance of this block front to 133rd Street. Note that W. 132nd Street is not
cut thru this block.
View No. 2 is a south eastward view across the aforerentioned feature. Cn the right margin of this view aopears the steel pillars of the elevated section of the I.R.T. subwav line.
April 1, 1938.
Views 1 a nd 2
P.L. Sperr

717744f-b.text:
Broadway, east side, north from W. 131st Street, showing at the N.E. corner of that point, a cleared area and upon which formerly stood Manhattan College. Tbthe north of same is the Dash Co. garage and sales room occupying the balance of this block front to 133rd Street. Note that W. 132nd Street is not
cut thru this block.
View No. 2 is a south eastward view across the aforerentioned feature. Cn the right margin of this view aopears the steel pillars of the elevated section of the I.R.T. subwav line.

Views 1 a nd 2
P.L. Sperr

715551f-a.text:
622 West 131st Street, south side, between Broadway and Twelfth avenue. This is a three-story frame house. The first story has a brick front and the two upper stories are of wood.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 314
